responsesPilot.responsesSwitchLink: Switch back to the classic Responses view

not-supported.title: Web browser not supported
not-supported.body: This browser cannot use the File System Access API. Try a different browser or give your browser permission to save files to your device.

startPage.intro: Get responses in fewer steps with a form API key.

beforeStart.heading: Before you start
beforeStart.generateKey: Generate an API key for your form in Settings.
beforeStart.generateKeyDetail: This is how you’ll retrieve high volumes of responses more easily and securely.
beforeStart.browserSupport: Ensure you’re using Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge.
beforeStart.browserSupportDetail: You'll be asked permission to copy and save files to your device. Accept these browser alerts to use the feature.
beforeStart.attachSafety: Take caution when opening files attachments.
beforeStart.attachSafetyDetail: Check files before opening them, verify malicious file attributes, and follow warning prompts.

uploadKey.title: Select your API key file to access new responses.

chooseLocation.title: Choose a download location to save response files.

selectFormat.title: Select the format of responses and download.

loadKeyPage.title: Select your API key
loadKeyPage.detail: Your form’s API key unlocks access to responses without needing development resources for a custom API integration. This allows you to get more than 150 responses at a time and removes the confirmation step that involved copying-pasting receipt codes.
loadKeyPage.noNewResponsesDetail: Your form has received 0 new submissions.
loadKeyPage.uploadSuccessMessage: You can now retrieve all new responses for this form.
loadKeyPage.uploadFailedMessage: Make sure you select the correct file. If it's not working, try regenerating a new API key for your form and adding it again.

lostKeyTip.title: Don't have your API key?
lostKeyTip.text1: Only one API key file can be associated to a form at a time.
lostKeyTip.text2: Generate a new API key by going to

locationPage.title: Select a save location
locationPage.subheading: Decide where new responses will be downloaded.
locationPage.detail: You’ll be asked by your browser to authorize the writing of files to the selected folder. Make sure to allow this permission in your browser settings.

csvDetected.title: CSV response file detected in folder
csvDetected.message: New response data will be appended to the existing CSV file.

getTemplateFailed.title: Failed to fetch form template
getTemplateFailed.message: There was an error retrieving the form template. Please try again later.

formatPage.title: Choose a response file format
formatPage.detail: Downloads will also include source data (JSON files). These raw data represents the “official submission of record” and provides an automatic check that the files you are getting match up to what’s been submitted.

csv.label: Spreadsheet (Combined in 1 CSV file)
csv.hint: Data can be appended, if a previous CSV exists in the folder seleted.

confirmationPage.errorOccurred: An error occurred during the download process
confirmationPage.savedTo: All form submission data can be found in:
confirmationPage.maliciousAttachmentsWarningTitle: Be cautious when opening files attached to submissions.
confirmationPage.maliciousAttachmentsWarningBody: You'll find file attachments in a separate folder with files that were scanned as “potentially malicious” in a nested folder. Check for “malicious” attributes or the “⚠️” symbol in responses and follow all warning prompts.

processingPage.note: For large downloads, you can expect it to take minutes for hundreds of responses and hours for thousands of responses.

rateLimitExceeded.title: Rate limit exceeded
rateLimitExceeded.message: You have exceeded the number of allowed requests. Please wait before trying again.

unknownError.title: Something went wrong
unknownError.message: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again later.

errorRetreivingSubmissions.title: Error retrieving submissions
errorRetreivingSubmissions.message: There was an error retrieving form submissions. Please try again later.

fileLockedError.title: Unable to modify the file
fileLockedError.message: Cannot write to the CSV file. The file may be open, or locked by another application. Please close the file and try again.

invalidStateError.title: File in invalid state
invalidStateError.message: The CSV file is in an invalid state and cannot be modified. The file may be open, locked, or corrupted.

quotaExceededError.title: Storage space exceeded
quotaExceededError.message: Not enough storage space is available to write to the file. Please free up space and try again.

permissionError.title: Unable to modify folder contents
permissionError.message: Please grant your browser “edit” or “write” access to transfer responses to the selected folder. You can find this in the browser's menu. Your department may have blocked this functionality.
